page.title: 16Lympstone Britain in Bloom
page.content: Lovely Lympstone,winner of the Britain in Bloom Competition for over a decade; overall winner of the large villages in Great Britain competition1983;runner- up in the European"Entente Florale", representing G.B.in 1984.1985,Lympstone won the {Abbiss Cup},an open award for any town,city or village showing great effort in the South West.Lympstone went forward to the England section,won and was finally judged against villages for the Great Britain Award.{won 1985} The Lympstone-in-Bloom committee not only tend their gardens but have made colourful flower-beds on the banks and walls throughout the village.Displays include a flower-filled wagon,a plough surrounded by pansies and fishing-boats brimming with flowers.Even the railway station is decorated.40 hanging baskets placed in the streets were kept watered throughout the summer.By Mrs McIlveen.
